website_summaries.verdict: A Powerboost feature helps clear stubborn debris on this cordless model.
pros: Sweeper works best to clear debris from from hard surfaces such as driveways, sidewalks, garages, and patios
Built to produce low noise for quiet operation
Powerboost increases air force to clear stubborn debris when in use
Compatible with power tools in the 20V MAX system
cons: Not a very powerful leaf blower, even on Turbo mode

customer_reviews.title: Great sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: Great sweeper! I am using this as Black & Decker intended, as a sweeper. We have a 100 foot driveway with a fir tree next to it. The needles from the tree can cover the driveway and this works great at sweeping out the needles. For the pine cones I do need to use the power boost occasionally. I also use this on the walkway, porch, and garage. It is light and somewhat quiet. I was a bit hesitant after reading the negative reviews but I do not need to blow leaves from my grass only sweep dry hard surfaces. If that is all you need to do then this should work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Now THIS is my favorite garden tool
customer_reviews.text: Now THIS is my favorite garden tool!! It was my B&D weed wacker, but this is more fun. I will never have a gas or electric cord tool again!! I love that they interchange the battery with the weed wacker. One battery will last about 15 minutes of blowing the leaves on the patio, driveway, steps and to clean up the mulch. Because I have the B&D weed wacker i have 5 batteries, so I am never without power. But to weedwack and blow the front yard I only need 3 total batteries. So worth getting an extra battery or two charged and ready to go. I can't say enough good things about this product.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN ENGEL

customer_reviews.title: At $89 It's an Expensive Toy - But Read On
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of Black and Decker cordless 20V Max products. This one is by far the "cheapest made" and the least powerful. I've had no issue with the battery lasting long enough, but you are not going to effectively move leaves around a yard for example. Dry debris on dry surfaces like a walkway or a driveway, no problem, but anything else is asking too much - even wet grass after mowing isn't going to move. PS I exclusively use it on the power boost mode. Do not buy the lower model without this mode. Then there really wouldn't be a point.
customer_reviews.author: MartinQ

customer_reviews.title: No blow blower
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd B&D 20V blower purchased. My first 2 did not have this burst feature this one has and are great blowers. I bought this one thinking it would be as powerful with an even stronger burst as the other ones I have. They dropped the blowing power to half and the burst option is almost as powerful as the less expensive counterparts. I will not ever buy one of these and I strongly recomend you not spend the $20 extra for this worthless feature.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Condon

customer_reviews.title: Leaf Breezer
customer_reviews.text: This is a leaf breeze, not a leaf blower. There is no force of air coming out of this thing, it only was able to push around the leaves on solid concrete - but forget about blowing anything laying on top of grass or other surfaces. We use the B&D Lithium Battery products for other things around the house but we returned this and went with a corded model to actually get any gust of wind to move our leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: For what it is it's fine
customer_reviews.text: Know that you arne't getting a high power backpack leaf blower here. This is alight duty blower capable of blowing grass clippings off a sidewalk or blowing dirt and other stuff out of your shop. You're not going to be blowing autumn leaves off your yard with it. It's not really built for that. Keep that in mind and it's a fine piece of kit for your 20v tool collection, very lightweight easy to maneuver into tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Trail cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I use it to clear the leaves off hiking trails in a large park. If the leaves are dry, the blower works great. It is light weight so I can easily pack it in and carry it up steep hills. I would encourage those who use it for larger jobs to get the fast charger and the extra sized battery. The B/D charger takes about seven hours. The only thing I would change is to make the thumb on/off button easier to use--a sweaty thumb easily slides over the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: I love Black and Decker products, but this one was a flop. I get B&D products becasue the batteries are interchangeable, and I never run out of a battery with a full charge. This leaf blower was not a quality B&D product. The air coming out of this would hardly blow out a candle (not that I tried, but just saying) I used the extra power, and still no 130 MPH air like it says. After about 30 to 45 seconds, it stopped. I turned it off and back on and it worked for about 5 more seconds. I returned the item with no problem. I still love B&D products, but this one was not one of their best.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought b&d blower from Lowe’s and he said that it was so powerful and he wanted buy little less power but Lowe’s didn’t have it . I bought him this B&D from Amazon so I hoped he will like it. It was ok . Not really satisfied. It is easy to use but not enough power to blow other than leaves dust as you can see in video. My busy said he will make it work . Hope so
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: Although I gave a 4 star rating might change to a 5 star later. Initial charge took over 10 hours. Will see how recharging goes. Bought the upgraded from the LSW 221 due to battery life in reviews and only .3.7 lbs. works for me. Owned over 7 homes throughout the years being retired military. Bought many Black & Decker products over the years. Live in apartment now and used to clean patio and hallway in front of door and cobwebs by light. Live in a college town and still working on teaching some residents respect. They have a bad habit of leaving trash in hallways. Otherwise would recommend this product for purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ed K

customer_reviews.title: It was a perfect gift for her
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter who wanted to blow leaves off her driveway and front terrace. It was a perfect gift for her. Lightweight and easy to handle. It is cordless, so you can take it anywhere. The battery lasts long enough for simple chores and it is powerful enough for a light cleaning. However, it will not move a big pile of leaves. I then bought one for my son, and he likes it too, so I eventually got one for myself. I have a long circular driveway and did not want to get an electric blower which would require a very long cord. This is a very nice blower.
customer_reviews.author: cd618

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great for light jobs such as sweeping out garage, sidewalks and driveways. Will blow dead debris off dry grass - a little more stubborn on wet leaves etc. BE CAREFUL YOU GET THE BATTERY CHARGER OUT OF THE LITTLE CARDBOARD PACKAGE IN THE BOX. Initially I thought I had not received one. I have used B&D sweepers for years. They do what they are advertised to do...not as powerful as a corded or gas blower, but so much easier to use. Good for folks with arthritis and those not wanting to dance around cords.
customer_reviews.author: msround

customer_reviews.title: Product performance has been disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a Black and Decker blower that had worn out. Did my research on this sweeper and while I found good reviews, it hasn’t met my expectations. The blowing capability is roughly half the capacity of the previous model I was replacing and while it is certainly functional, it only provides mediocre performance. I currently own the family of shared battery Black and Decker outdoor tools and this sweeper is the only one that hasn’t met the expectations of the rest of that collection.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite outdoor tool! It's so easy to charge and then clear off my decks each morning, especially during pollen season. I've loathed using the broom and this tool makes it easy and fun. Not to mention fast! Sometimes I use it twice a day just because it's so easy. Have also used it on driveway to remove grass clippings after mowing. You won't use this in a professional setting for an hour as the charge lasts only 20-25 minutes, but for the average homeowner this is great. Battery pack is compatible with hedge trimmer which was a huge selling point. Also, it's quiet!
customer_reviews.author: SaraOnTheGo

customer_reviews.title: good vs a broom
customer_reviews.text: great for what I got it for -- sweeping dry grass and leaves off the walk and driveway. I can tell it is very low power, but it still moves a considerable amount of air.. I think it does a good job for that, but I'll still get the corded electric unit out for tougher stuff *edit* -- had it for a few weeks now, an unexpected use is *indoors*.. I take this around my house and blow the cobwebs out of the corners, from under the bed, under the couch, and any other nook and cranny that hides dust.. it's such a clean running machine, no worries running it inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Power Switch hard to turn on
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the power switch was difficult for me, an older woman with little hand strength to turn on. Over the two months I've used it, the switch is impossible to turn on without using something to push it forward. That said, the rest of the blower is easy to carry, charge, and clears my porch, driveway and sidewalks easily. It blew wet leaves and I do not have to use the boost button ever. Black and Decker had a great idea, just a cheap execution on the switch design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little blower
customer_reviews.text: I feed wild birds on my back porch and a broom doesn't clean well. This blower does a great job on birdseed shells. It's light duty, easy to move around, and relatively speaking, inexpensive. Very happy with it- but it is underpowered so I suggest the 4Amp/Hr battery not the 1.5 it came with
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: A sweeping blower.  Not a leaf blower.
customer_reviews.text: Good blower for the cost. It has the proprietary brand of a Dewalt product (B&D is owned by Dewalt), without the cost of one. With it, you get the quality of a B&D product. It's essential to sweeping off grass clipping from a dry sidewalk. Do not expect this to be your primary leaf blower in autumn. You will be frustrated at the fact it does not have the blowing speed of a gas-powered blower. This is a light duty blower, so if you are looking for that, search no further. If you need something that is stronger, look for something gas powered, or with a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Bracamonte

customer_reviews.title: Good for Patio - Balcony’s - Small areas
customer_reviews.text: I have an outdoor patio about 300 ft.2 which gets a bunch of dog hair and a few leaves occasionally this is perfect for that use. You will need a larger/stronger blower for the larger outside areas, driveway leaves etc. because this is not powerful enough to handle a garden job unless it’s something very small. Bottom line is I’m satisfied with it for the use intended, that’s the main point.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Average at best, get used to using the boost button
customer_reviews.text: This is thing is average. It works best when you push the boost button and keep it on. These battery blowers don't come close to the gas driven ones we are all used to. If you expect this performance, you will be disappointed. If you don't expect much and are willing to keep your thumb on the booster button, it will get by blowing grass clippings off the deck and leaves off the walk way. Set your expectations correctly and this might work for you. I did not send it back. I'm still in search of a better one without going gas.
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable vs the LSW221 which has weak output. LSW321 has a boost button increasing output 40%.
customer_reviews.text: Returned Model LSW221 which has weak output versus this unit costing $10 more because it has boost button that increases the output flow by about 40% making it acceptable versus the LSW221. I keep an electric for very heavy duty when rarely needed. Another positive is that the 20VDC battery is compatible with the 2 I use on our B&D weedeater giving us 3 interchangeable ones. Those 2 original weedeater batteries have lasted quite well holding a charge so I'm hopefully the new one with this blower will too
customer_reviews.author: Dean P Wichert

customer_reviews.title: A Sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweeper, not a leaf blower to compete with a gas or an EGO. However, I am disabled, and this works great for me to sweep my garage, patio, etc. I can direct it with Ego gane and drive my powered scooter with the other. I already chose the B&D 20V family so I have multiple batteries (hedge clipper, drill, etc) so it is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for what it meant to be used for.
customer_reviews.text: You have to have the right mindset for this type of mini blower. It will not replace a large hand held or backpack blower. I use it for my garage, deck and porch to blow off dry/damp leaves and debris. Sometimes I use it on the driveway for a quick clean up. it's quick and easy for the wife and kids to quickly use for hard surfaces. I do have a backpack blower for bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Pankratz

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Handy
customer_reviews.text: If you only want to blow dust bunnies off your patio, this "sweeper" is for you. If you keep the boost engaged you might be able to accomplish a little more, but the battery will only last about 12 minutes. A disappointing product from Black & Decker. Not recommended! Update: I have learned to appreciate this sweeper for convenience and for its intended purpose; lightweight "sweeping ". It's pretty handy when the job is small. Upgrading to 3-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all for a B&D product
customer_reviews.text: First off, I NEVER buy B&D products as they have not historically worked well/reliably for me. Having said that, this one was at a price point that I couldn't ignore given the limited amount of use we would have for it. It has performed very well in the removal of leaves/debris from our patio. In fact, I recently bought a B&D cordless weed wacker from Lowes that uses the same battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: PAHunter

customer_reviews.title: Performance poor
customer_reviews.text: Low Cu Ft per Minute or low MPH blowing. Very disappointed. My older B&D 20V Cordless Sweeper (died after 10 years) had better performance than this model with the power boost button pressed. 100 MPH is pretty standard, but compare CFM before buying. Returned to seller.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Strandberg

customer_reviews.title: Great for light duty sweeping
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for light duty sweeping of the garage, patio, sidewalk, etc. It's cordless so no need to get out and drag a long extension cord. It would not be very practical for sweeping leaves on a large area. The one issue I had was that the power switch became very difficult to turn on after only a few uses. Fortunately a little silicone spray under the slide switch solved the problem. All in all, I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Smith

customer_reviews.title: Leaf clearing NOT a "breeze".
customer_reviews.text: This blower has about 1/3 of the power of the corded B&D leaf blower. You MUST use the power boost 100% of the time. Has problems moving pine needles and pine cones from the driveway. I own 3 other 20V BD products so have xtra batteries, thankfully. I plan to keep it cuz too much trouble to return but this is a big disappointment compared to the other 20V yard tools. Do NOT recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Good Portable Blower
customer_reviews.text: This is a good portable blower. I like that I don't have to drag a cord around. I have multiple batteries which is a must if you need to use it for any length of time. It isn't very powerful without the turbo boast going. It will get the job done but will take you a bit longer. It is nice and light weight with great balance for using one handed. Overall I am happy with this blower. Would have liked it to be a bit more powerful but still does the job of clearing the driveway of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Interesting blower!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about my Black and Decker leaf blower, although It was extremely light weight, and that was concerning to me. I wasn't sure if it would get the job done because of past reviews I read...Well, In conclusion it did everything that was expected, and I was concerned if I had the power to finish a recent grass/leaf blowing session because I had forgot to recharge the battery after the last use. I was very pleased to report It had enough battery power with more power to spare, so It is definitely a keeper! Thanks for reading, Lynn K
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Levelset your expectations
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and debating the purchase for months I took the plunge. I do feel it is a bit over priced and can be improved on (more power) so I withheld a star; also it came with a battery and they are about half the cost of the tool. I have several batteries now so battery life isn't an issue for me, if it were 25% more powerful it would be a homerun. But I have found many uses for this and as long as you know its limitations you can make good use of it. Mainly as a sweeper for walkways, porches and patios. I don't regret the purchase, I will get value out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power for car drying
customer_reviews.text: I used this for drying my car after washing. It’s output may be rated a 130 MPH but it was no better than a smaller one I purchased from Amazon, other than battery life. Now I have two of these leaf blowers & neither do the job. Looks like I’ll spring for the Adams Air Dryer as several users said it only takes 10 min to dry their car with the Adams. If I hadn’t thrown away the box I would return the B&D.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Excelent light duty blower.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want it to do. I replaced a gas blower with this one due to the weight and fuel storage requirements. This one will not keep up with a back pack gas one but it is great for cleaning grass & leaves off on sidewalks and driveways without the inconvenience associated with the larger units. A great buy for the price and very easy to use. The high speed feature handles the more difficult piles of waste with ease. Battery life is longer than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Squid

customer_reviews.title: This little air broom is terrific.
customer_reviews.text: I use the sweeper/blower to clear my patio, front entry and driveway of debris and get about 25 min of use on each charge; I have three batteries so I can use for longer periods. It is especially useful in keeping the debris movement under control as you would using a broom. Lightweight and handy for quick clean ups. I have purchased many for family and friends as gifts. Highly recommend this as a primary tool for anyone who regularly sweeps outdoor areas.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a battery powered blower.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit smaller and weaker than I expected but I can't say I'm disappointed due to the value of the product. It doesn't cost much but I would consider this a "good" leaf blower for driveway and patio areas rather than high volume of leaves in grass. It just can't handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Raum

customer_reviews.title: Love this blower! Ideal for small areas when you need a low amount of noise.
customer_reviews.text: I live under four 80 year old sycamore trees and I deal with lots of leaves on my courtyard and driveway. I own a gas blower for heavy leaves but I needed a quiet blower for my courtyard. This blower is great, lightweight, quiet and has enough power to move large sycamore leaves. I have not had any issues with the length of time the battery lasts. My neighbor borrowed it and is now ordering one for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This blower works good, is light and easy to use. Stays charged plenty long enough to clean our 30 foot patio, 50 feet of side walk, and our 30' long double car wide driveway. I clears leaves from border rocks what would otherwise be impossible to sweep. If you want a blower to clean your payment, this one works great, but if you want to use a blower in lieu of racking your yard, you'd better look for one of those loud gas jobies. This one if very quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Creen

customer_reviews.title: Worx vs B&D
customer_reviews.text: The blower is not powerful at all....my 4 year old small Worx blower blows the B&D away....pun intended..... When you need extra power your suppose to push another button the "power button" which is a waste and not very comfortable doing anyway... They Wasted their time putting the power button on they should've just added the little extra power to the unit itself. I'm sending mine back and getting 40v Worx variable speed for bout same price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Low power
customer_reviews.text: I really like Black & Decker products and love the idea that the rechargable batteries can be used with other products; however, I am disappointed with the power in this unit. The power of the air that is coming out is nominal compared to other B&D air blowers - even with the "power boost," it's still disappointing. In order to do a quick job, you have to keep the power boost button on; however, without the power boost it will get the job done. This is why I gave it a 3 star rating. B&D could have done a better job by giving it a little more power to it.
customer_reviews.author: William B Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good for the kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a light duty leaf blower. It is smaller and lighter than your regular electric blower and you will probably need to use the turbo feature for everything you do. That said, it almost feels like a toy and is suitable for the kids and wife. If you need a small job, like blowing off the patio or garage your kids can manage it for you. Since it is light and battery operated it is very convenient to pull it out for quick and easy use.
customer_reviews.author: WPDP

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this blower!
customer_reviews.text: Worst blower ever!! I had Black and Decker battery powered blower rhat l loved and used all the time. The switch broke so i ordered this to replace it. The switch on this blower is impossible to move, you need to use a screwdriver or something to move the switch on and off. My husband has very strong hands (he works construction) but he can't move the switch. The blowing power is nothing, won't even move a dry leaf. Worthless!
customer_reviews.author: DDSD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light sweeping.
customer_reviews.text: It weighs practically nothing, Not as powerful as the corded or gas BLOWERS. To sweep DRY leaves and debris from a driveway, walk or garage it is so convenient to just pick up and sweep it all away. The turbo button does really give it a bit more noticeable power. Wish I had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brewbier

customer_reviews.title: A little under powered, but perfect for small and smooth surfaces
customer_reviews.text: This blower works as advertised and is very small and easy to use. It works fine as a broom replacement in my garage and on my patio. The unit could have a little more power for my purpose. This would not work well if you want to blow leaves in the yard or other more demanding task than blowing stuff off of a smooth surface. Again, this works fine for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Easty

customer_reviews.title: Faster and Easier than a Broom  :)
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for to get the grass clippings off my driveway and clear off all the dust, mulch and debris that my dogs kick onto the flag stone path in my backyard. So much easier and faster than sweeping with a broom and it weighs one-third of what my EGO leaf blower weighs. (And I now have a third battery to use with my other B&D tools that I run much longer than the few minutes it takes to do my "sweeping".)
customer_reviews.author: reddogs

customer_reviews.title: Limited capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: This item couldn't go 130mph if it were riding in a very fast car. Perhaps the airspeed is 130mph but the volume is that of what might come out of a thimble has little effect. I bought the product because it has the same Black and Decker battery system of my weed trimmer. (which I am happy with). It would be fine if you simply need to blow a few blades of grass to the edge of the sidewalk or blow a few errant leaves out of the garage. However asking it to do much more, like moving even a small pile of leaves is simple beyond its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Omaha Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Blower is not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Black& Decker battery operated and electric tools for many years and always been satisfied with their performance, but this blower is an exception. It functions somewhat on smooth hard surfaces, but don't plan on using it on anything else. It simply does not have enough power even if you press the Power Boost. My purchase was not a complete waste of money, because I did get a 20 volt battery and a charger to use with my other Black and Decker 20-volt tools
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great sweeper for hard surfaces
customer_reviews.text: This sweeper is advertised for use on sidewalks and driveways. It is not as powerful as an electric or gas blower. But what I like about it is how great it works for cleaning leaves off the bark. I have all bark in the yard and the sweeper blows off the leaves with out removing the bark. Also, it is wonderful to have a cordless so the card doesn't get tangled in the shrubs and bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, don't expect a ton of power out of this thing. However, it is extremely light and easy to swing around with one arm. Being battery operated makes it a snap to grab it and start blowing without the prep of pulling out extension cords, or getting gas if it's gas powered. It just depends on what you need to use it for... blowing off your driveway, garage, porch, it's just fine. Anything more demanding, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Stephann Alker

customer_reviews.title: No better than ones without power boost
customer_reviews.text: Probably longer battery life on 'normal' air flow but not as powerful without using the boost as the older ones were. Definitely not worth a higher price. I have a garage full of Black & Decker 20v tools and this is not one of the better ones.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaHokie

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Was Expecting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a backup for my B&D LSW20. The speed of the LSW321 might be equal in the Turbo mode versus the LSW20, but not the regular speed which was disappointing. I wish I had a device to measure the blowing speed. If it blows at 130 mph as B&D claims, I don't think it does. That is why I only gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GWC

customer_reviews.title: Although it doesn't have the Air Velocity of my Trusty ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it doesn't have the Air Velocity of my Trusty 18V B&D Blower, it does come close thanks to the Turbo Button. The 18V can sometimes be too much for certain applications. I use it quite frequently when leaves from the Cherry Trees find their way into my Garage Area. For additional Truth and Commentary on the Political Scene and Media, tune in to the Gabor Zolna Channel on YouTube. Gabor is the Oracle of Truth and shares his Historical Perspective in OVER 18,000 Short Videos commenting on 'BIG Mike' and others.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky2bGorgeous

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for maintenance cleaning between major cleanings
customer_reviews.text: At normal power mode it is powerful enough do light duty cleaning such as blowing debris and leaves off drive way or deck. Just do not expect it to act like a serious blower. It is best suited as a maintenance cleaner in between major cleaning. Battery life is a problem so either get a 4 amh battery or have a spare 1.5 amh one. Overall I am satisfied with the sweeper.
customer_reviews.author: garunner

customer_reviews.title: Light weight blower
customer_reviews.text: Decent 'blower' - really more of a 'sweeper'. Handles light debris like dry leaves, lint accumulation on the patio from the dryer vent, etc. Couldn't be very useful in yard clean-ups of leaves and jobs that might require a powerful 'blower'. It is satisfactory for the purpose I bought it, namely as a 'sweeper' for the patio, garage and around the sidewalk. I wouldn't expect to use it for much more rugged and demanding cleaning/clearing jobs. A real plus is that it's ultra light and easy to handle. And, it seems to be well-constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: The power and longevity of the lithium battery is impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my B&D nickel cadmium battery leaf blower that is about four years old. While the old works well with new batteries, the strangth and longevity of the lithium is impressive. On "Turbo" most of the time, the 2A battery will last about 25 minutes. The old will be given to my son and family in that it continues to do a good job. I ranked a four star versus five because I need to be on "turbo" to be most effective.
customer_reviews.author: California Tennis Player

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing, overall.
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful at all. Turbo mode is decent, but this thing has about 1/2 the power I was looking for. I will probably keep it for blowing off my porch and maybe inside my shed and truck bed or camper storage bays, but there is no way this could tackle my yard or driveway. The biggest plus to this is, the battery fits my drill. :)
customer_reviews.author: M.Howard

customer_reviews.title: At 71 I have shoulder problems & this blower is so much lighter than anything gas powered & you don't have to mess with a cord like my old electric blower
customer_reviews.text: This makes my clean up work so much easier. At 71 I have shoulder problems & this blower is so much lighter than anything gas powered & you don't have to mess with a cord like my old electric blower. I really appreciate using this product. Quality seems to be really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Not a very powerful blower, but I knew that ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a very powerful blower, but I knew that when I bought it. I bought it just to blow dry leaves, nuts and twigs from my RV slide out roof before retracting it. For certain, buy the model with the boost switch as you will not have enough power for anything without it. This item does not replace a gas powered or other ultra powerful blower for general yard work.
customer_reviews.author: R DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & light blower!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for ourselves and we use it constantly. I use it to blow leaves off of my patio and porch, and debris that ends up in my garage and all over the driveway. The battery lasts a long time and charges quickly. This blower is so convenient and handy that we purchased this one for a gift for family. It's so lightweight and easy to use. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Walls

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight; however not very powerful, good for flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I have an old B&D 18v blower and bought this for my girlfriend, it is not as powerful. It is light and the battery is easier to get in and out. Will clear pathways, decks etc. However you will use the boost button all of the time, should have made it a two position switch do you would not have to keep pressing the button.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS BONNEY

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a yard-full-of-leaves blower. It's an more like a air broom. That's what I bought it for. I have yard blowers... but they are too powerful and clunky to get out just to blow off the front steps and back patio every day. That's what this guy does! Works perfectly as a porch and patio 'broom'. Light weight. Always ready.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Light and Easy to Use with Good Power
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how well this would work, but it has enough power to clear off leaves, dirt, wings, yard cuttings etc. And it is light enough for this 68 year old with arthritis to use.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Just "OK" for a blower. Fairly under-powered.
customer_reviews.text: Rated at 130 MPH, but I have a hard time believing that. I'm keeping it because hard surfaces are all I'm blowing off, but it takes longer than it should with this blower. If you're blowing anything other than driveways and sidewalks, this is not the blower for you. You have to hold down the power boost button constantly to get decent results.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: The blower is fine, however
customer_reviews.text: The blower is fine, however, the battery does not hold a charge. I bought a 2nd one for my husband to keep in his work van, and that battery doesn't hold a charge either. Purchased a spare battery and that one holds a charge. Trying to reach Black and Decker concerning these batteries. The blower itself is lightweight and works beautifully. Very pleased with that part.
customer_reviews.author: Gay L Davison

customer_reviews.title: Dust Bunnies!
customer_reviews.text: What i like is that it is convenient and quieter. My old blower was electric and i had to hassle with that 100' cord twice a week when i had to blow off the sidewalk, driveway and patio. What i didn't like was any implication in the marketing that the 130 mph blower was powerful. Did a good job taking out the dust bunnies on the hardwood floor under the bed, though.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient Blower Power
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a lot of Black and Decker products over the years and have always been very happy with them - until this blower. If you’re trying to blow dust from a flat surface, it would be fine. However, its use on grass - even with dry leaves - is problematic. Even when on the high setting, it still produces very low blowing power. Additionally, the on/off switch is stiff and hard to use. Would not buy this again nor recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: The Eman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money they ask $20 to 30 Max
customer_reviews.text: This product is light and easy to use but it is way underpowered And hardly blows at all if you looking for Something to Leaves or anything heavier than dust do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Lite Weight Blower
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so that my wife could use it. Tradition gas-powered blowers weight too much for her to handle. It works well for blowing out the garage, blowing off sidewalks and driveways, etc. It is not effective when blowing leaves in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my simple garage
customer_reviews.text: Very good for my simple garage, driveway and patio. I also use it to blow off light accumulations of dust and spider webs from the house and window areas. . Nice lightweight and I like the extra super power button for more blowing power. I have numerous batteries as a result of buying like products, but I have never used more than one battery at a use session. Even on the highest setting. It works nice for blowing edged grass and dirt from my paved areas. I do not think it would work on very wet leaves or heavy leaf falls. It worked great for my rain gutters with mild accumulations of leaves, dirt, and composite shingle debris.
customer_reviews.author: richard mueller

customer_reviews.title: Great Item for quick "sweep-ups."
customer_reviews.text: Great item to have for quick "sweep ups" of porches, decks, driveways etc. Also very effective for blowing leaves off of graveled areas, won't blow the gravel away. Don't confuse with a leave blower, not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Koilover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Light weight. 20 minutes using the power surge button constantly. 4 hours to recharge, despite some comments stating 1 hour. I bought the high capacity battery as a spare, since we have a very large yard. This is for light duty, but it worked for me. Very quiet. I would gladly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but good for hard surfaces (patio
customer_reviews.text: Really simple to pop together right out of the box. If you have another B & D 20 volt battery, it's interchangeable, which is convenient. Definitely not as powerful as a gas or corded blower, but good for hard surfaces (patio, deck, sidewalk, porch). I used it for about 20 minutes on high power, and the battery had plenty of charge left.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice..
customer_reviews.text: This model does not have sufficient power for my need (blowing the leaves off the patio, garage, porch and sidewalk). I use the power boost for those uses. it came with a 2.0AH battery that will last for about 3 sessions. I do have another 20V tool, pole saw, and purchased a 4.5AH battery so they are sufficient. I make sure to keep them all charged. The lighter leaf blower makes it easy to keep the place clean.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight, quiet and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Put down the broom, this will do the job! I love this little trusty blower. It doesn't put out a ton of blown air, but to blow the residual grass after mowing the lawn and clearing out your lining remnants, this does the trick. I have the B&D trimmer edger too, so I'm able to interchange the batteries when one runs out. The blower is light-weight and has done everything I've asked of it.
customer_reviews.author: PerfectPoodle

customer_reviews.title: Not a powerful blower but ok for dry hard surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine a week ago and yeah, you need the Power Boost to get anything to move. The good part is that I don't have to schlep a power cord all around and its very light to carry. Three stars because, its just average. Nothing really wrong with it and nothing to brag about. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Nekoatl

customer_reviews.title: My wife's new favorite garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: We've had a gas blower, but it is too heavy for my wife to use when she just wants to do some quick cleanup in the yard. She asked for one of these and is delighted with it. It is lightweight, doesn't use its charge too quickly, and is perfect for light cleanup around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Lame.  Weak sister.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace an earlier B&D leaf blower. This one is just a weak sister. Battery charge won’t last very long. Fortunately I keep three batteries fully charged. Power Boost switch should be able to be turned on constantly. Overpriced. Next one will be a green one. This Orange wimp won’t last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wimp
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for the B&D single speed 20v max blower. This one puffs out about half the wind on regular and about three quarters @ boost. The on/off switch requires super power thumbs to turn on and off. My wife is not strong enough to use it.,
customer_reviews.author: Manong John

customer_reviews.title: Just a sweeper not a leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says a sweeper it is NOT a leaf blower. is great for cleaning small areas of debry, leaves and lawn clippings but just SMALL areas.
customer_reviews.author: Wilmarie Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Does small jobs well
customer_reviews.text: Wife needed lightweight & this is. Not a lot of power, but it’ll blow a feckless clean with a lot less effort than a broom. But it’s not the same as a gas powered type
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Another great addition to my collection
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few of the Black & Decker 20V tools. This one is no different than the rest. It works great, easy to handle and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: cwatson

customer_reviews.title: Way more convenient than gas, just lacks the power.
customer_reviews.text: It works great to blow out the garage or deck. If you are blowing leaves or grass out of your driveway, you will be holding the max power button at all times. Wish it had more power. Battery life is very short on batteries less than 2 amp. I will say my garage is cleaner because I can just slap a battery in and blow it out. Way more convenient than gas, just lacks the power.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Love going cordless !
customer_reviews.text: No more cords for me. Not quite powerful to blow lots of leaves in the Fall, but for clearing patio and sidewalks throughout the summer it works great. Got the trimmer too and found that 20V is perfect for my yard. Charge lasts quite some time before needing recharge.Has two different power settings.
customer_reviews.author: Why Me.

customer_reviews.title: Week blow power
customer_reviews.text: This was meant to replace the same product bought four years ago, which was stolen. It is about the same price but much less powerful, not worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Cordless Sweeper with Power Boost is easy to use. It does a good job in blowing the grass clippings where you want them to go. The cordless sweeper is light. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Born 2 shop

customer_reviews.title: I can use it for other light duty "sweeping" and it works fine for that
customer_reviews.text: It's basically OK for what I bought it for. I use it to clear leaves off my large deck and it does that well, and much more quickly than using a broom. As mentioned by others, it is a light duty sweeper... NOT a leaf blower. I can use it for other light duty "sweeping" and it works fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: New design seems not as powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Black & Decker. None have broken, I just keep finding more uses. But this was had a surprise. I did not know the standard speed is lower and there is a button to get an extra boost, This must be to extend battery life which makes sense but I bought these over and over due to good operation.
customer_reviews.author: D. G

customer_reviews.title: It's very average
customer_reviews.text: If you need something with power, this is not the right product. If you need something light weight that blow a few leaves and little dirt away, this is your product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very powerful sweeper. Have to bump up to the "boost" button to get the leaves off my deck, which decreases the battery life. I kept it because it is lightweight and will get the job done eventually. I have another Black and Decker weed eater that uses the same battery, so I have enough battery power to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for blowing off driveways and decks
customer_reviews.text: Had this for approximately 3 months. Works fine for blowing off driveways and decks. I was hoping for more power and almost constantly use the power booster button. Good for what I need it for, but won't work for blowing leaves off the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Willard the Rat

customer_reviews.title: REALLY 😰
customer_reviews.text: I could probably blow harder myself! It is pretty pathetic unfortunately. I will have to put out more money to get a more powerful one to blow leaves and grass off my sidewalk. Wonder if I could use it to blow dry my hair since it’s a total loss as a viable tool? 😰
customer_reviews.author: Jean foley

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and balanced. Battery pack holds a charge pretty well. To give you an idea, I only have to put it on the charger every 2-3 weeks, and I clear my 30-40 ft sidewalk about 3 times a week. Recharge seems to be fairly quick, but I generally just leave it on overnight.
customer_reviews.author: L Cranston

customer_reviews.title: a very handy ladies' leaf blower for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: this is great for small jobs, dry leaves on a patio and so on. does not work for heavy seed pods,etc or for stuff that is soggy. the main selling point for me is that this tool is light, easy to use for a petite elderly female. i agree with other reviewers that this is not a powerful blower.
customer_reviews.author: Anna F.

customer_reviews.title: ... and Decker products using the 20 volt batteries and like them. Recently I moved into a townhouse and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower because I have many of the Black and Decker products using the 20 volt batteries and like them. Recently I moved into a townhouse and didn't want the hassle of a gasoline powered blower so I thought that this would be a good purchase. This blower lacks power and I would recommend it only if you have limited need for a blower (for example a small patio or balcony). If you need a blower with a reasonable amount of power you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: toadhall2

customer_reviews.title: 20 volt Black and Decker blower
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for the original bower I purchase several year ago. Motor finally gave out after much use. This newer unit does not have as much power, even with the boost switch turned on. Wish I would have purchased the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely lightweight. I bought this due to a shoulder injury and I couldn't handle my gas blower anymore. However, due to being so lightweight it lacks power. It can handle little leaves, but nothing too though. I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great blower for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great blower for use around pool, gutters, walkways, and garage! Battery lasts long enough to get the job done! I like the two speeds, for better handling around the pool. Highly recommend for quick jobs around the house/pool!
customer_reviews.author: William C Staley

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not that strong
customer_reviews.text: Not as strong as I would like. Should of got a higher powered one. Although, it does the trick getting walkways / driveway cleared of sand, wood chips, light weight debris.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and great for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: I have a concrete driveway that seems to attract all kinds of stuff. I can take this blower and use it for 15 minutes and I am done and don't have to have a dustpan. Then I just recharge it. Very lightweight and much better than a broom!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you pick the model with two blow options. Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Get this model and not the one with only one blowing option, it is great for cleaning the garage, balconies or hard to reach areas. Great at blowing off spiderwebs, and light cleaning on the common areas in the driveway and pavement. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Wesolowski

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to handle for light jobs only.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and easy to handle. Unfortunately, normal power is low at best and the boost button just raises it to medium so it's only effective for light jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Hambletons

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Cordless Sweeper with Power Boost (LSW321)
product_meta.description: Style:Cordless SweeperThe BLACK+DECKER LSW321 20V MAX Lithium POWERBOOST Sweeper is part of the 20V MAX System; 1 System - Endless Tasks. Power for your Style. This is ideal for clearing driveways, sidewalks, decks, garages and other hard surfaces of leaves, grass clippings, and other lawn debris. This sweeper features POWERBOOST to increase power, up to 130 MPH sweeper easily clears debris from hard surfaces like driveways, decks, and garages. The premium micro texture soft grip provides comfort and control while using the tool, and a low noise design allows for quiet operation. This unit offers up to 25 minutes of runtime allows you to complete a variety of tasks. Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts. Nominal voltage is 18. Includes: (1) LSW321 20V MAX POWERBOOST Cordless Sweeper (1) LBXR2020 20V MAX Lithium Ion Extended Runtime Battery (1) Charger (1) Blow Tube. Do not store or use the tool and battery pack in locations where the temperature may reach or exceed 105°F (40 ̊C) (such as outside sheds or metal buildings in summer)
feature_bullets: 130 MPH sweeper easily clears debris from hard surfaces
Low noise design allows for quiet operation
Up to 25 minutes of runtime allows you to complete a variety of tasks
POWERBOOST increases power to clear stubborn debris
Part of the 20V MAX System; 1 System - Endless Tasks. Power for your Style

Part of the POWERCOMMAND Family of tools – EASYFEED, POWERCUT, POWERBOOST - helps solve common user frustrations when using Outdoor Power Equipment. Air Speed: 130 mph; Included Components: (1) LSW321 20V MAX* POWERBOOST Cordless Sweeper, (1) LBXR2020 20V MAX* Lithium Ion Extended Runtime Battery, (1) Charger, (1) Blow Tube

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars908 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
